content: keith materials 2 25mm circular needle minimum 80cm for working magic loop or 2 shorter circulars/dpns if preferred 100g/400m of 4-ply yarn ideally a blend containing nylon for strength gauge 34 stitches/52 row to 10cm/42 size to fit m l foot circumference 8-9 9-10 method cast on 64 72 stitches join for working in the round being careful not to twist cuff round 1 *k1 p1* repeat from * to end continue to work in rib for 14 more rounds 15 rounds in total leg round 1 *k3 p1* repeat from * to end rnds 2-5 as round 1 round 6 k all stitches round 7 *k1 p1 k2* repeat from * to end rnds 8-11 as round 7 round 12 k all stitches repeat these 12 rounds 4 more times then work rnds 1-6 again heel flap the heel is worked back and forth across half of the stitches rs *sl1 k1* repeat from * to end ws sl1 p to end repeat these two row a total of 16 18 times ending with a ws row heel turn r1 rs sl1 k 18 20 ssk k1 turn r2 ws sl1 p 7 p2tog p1 turn r3 rs sl1 k to 1 stitch before gap ssk k1 turn r4 ws s1 p to 1 stitch before gap p2tog p1 turn repeat row 3 and 4 until all stitches have been worked gusset sl1 k across heel flap stitches pick up and knit 1 stitch in each of the slipped stitches along the side of the heel flap plus 1 or 2 additional stitches at the join between the heel flap and instep work round 7 of pattern across instep stitches pick up and knit 1 stitch in each of the slipped stitches along the other side of the heel flap plus 1 or 2 additional stitches at the join between the heel flap and instep k to start of instep stitches this becomes the new beginning of the round round 1 work in pattern across instep stitches k1 ssk to 3 stitches before end of round k2tog k1 round 2 work in pattern across instep stitches k to end of round repeat these two rounds until all gusset stitches have been decreased and 64 72 stitches remain nb when working rnds 1-5 of the pattern on the foot you may wish to purl the last stitch of each previous round to provide symmetry with the purl stitch at the end of the instep stitches though this isn t strictly necessary foot continue to work as set until the foot measures 2 inches less than desired length ending with round 6 or 12 of the pattern toe round 1 k1 ssk k to 3 stitches before end of instep k2tog k2 ssk k to 3 stitches before end k2tog k1 round 2 k all stitches repeat these two rounds until 20 24 stitches remain break yarn and graft toes using kitchener stitch i designed these socks for my father keith
